str2: From hos with the directive enclitic of source; from which place or source or cause.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From peri and haireomai; to remove all around, i.e. Unveil, cast off; figuratively, to expiate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From kata and a derivative of anti; to meet against, i.e. Arrive at.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Latin origin; Rhegium, a place in Italy.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
The south wind, the South. Of uncertain affinity; the south(-west) wind; by extension, the southern quarter itself.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To arise, spring up, arrive, come on. From epi and ginomai; to arrive upon, i.e. Spring up.
Adj. where English requires an adv., on the second day, on the next day. From deuteros; secondary, i.e. on the second day.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Latin origin; little wells, i.e. Mineral springs; Potioli, a place in Italy.
